multiple_choice_question.text: What is the defining characteristic of Active Matter systems?
choices: They are always composed of living organisms.
They are driven far from equilibrium by external fields.
They have sustained energy uptake and dissipation at the individual constituent level.
They are governed by the laws of equilibrium thermodynamics.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following is NOT an example of Active Matter?
choices: A flock of birds changing direction in flight.
A monolayer of self-propelled colloidal particles.
The cytoskeleton within a living cell.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the term σ<sub>0</sub> = ζΔμQ<sub>ij</sub>  in the context of active nematic liquid crystals?
choices: It represents the equilibrium stress tensor.
It signifies the contribution of active processes to the stress tensor.
It describes the viscosity of the isotropic phase.
It denotes the orientational order parameter.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does the presence of active extensile stresses (σ<sub>0</sub> > 0) affect a smectic liquid crystal?
choices: It destabilizes the system, leading to a disordered state.
It has no effect on the system\'s stability.
It decreases the layer-spacing variance, reducing fluctuations.
It increases the layer-spacing variance, effectively stiffening the system.
